snippet.title: Garard's big lift at CrossFit titles
snippet.content:
HIGHLY-rated CrossFit athlete Ricky Garard has missed out on a ticket to the world games in the US after the Pacific titles in Wollongong.
Lift: Ricky Garard competes at the Australian Crossfit titles. Garard was just two points shy of a top five finish in the seven-event contest, which includes squat snatches, pull ups, running, rowing, hand stand walks, burpees, rope climbs, sit-ups, deadlifts, handstand walks and muscle ups. "I prepared myself as well as I possibly could for this event and competed to my best ability," Garard said.
"While I missed out on a place in LA, I am stoked to have made the Pacific event."
During competition, Garard achieved a personal record on a squat snatch by nine kilograms.
Coach and brother Ben Garard, who qualified for the Los Angeles world titles last year, praised the standard of competition. "It takes heart, ferociousness and a massive desire and will to compete at this level of CrossFit and Ricky displayed all those characteristics and more in Wollongong," Ben said.
